alert.note: Alert for Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 18 at 9:02AM AKDT until March 18 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blowing snow with low visibility and cold wind chills occuring. Plan on areas of poor visibilities to create difficult travel conditions at times. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Wind chills to 40 below. * WHERE...North of Noatak. * WHEN...Until 1 PM today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chills to 40 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Areas of low visibility and cold wind chills will improve this as winds slowly decrease. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means that visibilities will be limited due to strong winds blowing snow around. Use caution when traveling, especially in open areas.
